messages: 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:21): http://blogs.gnome.org/alexl/2010/11/23/gtk3-vs-html5/ oh dear.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:21): someone's gonna have to explain html to them.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:32): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: the same person who is going to explain HTML and JavaScript to Google?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:32): (GWT team in particular)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:32): yeah, probably
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:32): or indeed to the bespin team :-)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:34): WebSocket would be more appropriate for the use case than XHR
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:34): i'm far more concerned about the canvas side of it
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:34): XHR vs WebSocket doesn't really harm anyone except the programmer
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:35): I think there's a pending "yo, dawg" joke in there when they get a browser running
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:36): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: next, they need to implement an atk to ARIA bridge
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:36): we don't provide enough hooks for them to do it
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (11:36): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: then they can do gtk in the browser in the gtk in the browser
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:36): nor should we, the whole idea is hare-brained :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:37): (as implemented)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:37): would make much more sense to have gtk map to html
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:37): that would actually be useful
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:37): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: do we provide enough hooks for *that*?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:38): i dunno if we provide enough hooks to get you 100% of the way there
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:38): notes that VNC sends over bitmaps, not the semantics of the toolkit of the remote system
8269fc4aca67c69ef320ddd69881d4cc (11:38): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: didn't you see that the firefox copy he was running was actually inside a chrome tab?

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:39): but the 80% of the way there that you get will be 100% "native" compared to the vnc-like solution which can get you 100% of the way there in terms of pixels and precisely 0% of the way there in terms of native
8269fc4aca67c69ef320ddd69881d4cc (11:39): (I hope it wasn't)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:39): the word "accessibility" doesn't appear in the comment section of the blog post
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:39): (where native means hooking into system things like IME, accessibility, etc)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:47): speaking of native, I find it amusing (in a sad way) that the W3C offers an HTML/CSS/SVG reference as an Android app
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:49): there's also an online version I think
8269fc4aca67c69ef320ddd69881d4cc (11:49): I hope they don't go over the network in the app version, at least...
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:50): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I'm aware of the dogfood version
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (11:50): where's this reference?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:51): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: http://dev.w3.org/2009/cheatsheet/doc/android
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (11:57): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: thanks. i don't understand how i get to the "web" version from http://dev.w3.org/2009/cheatsheet/doc/
8269fc4aca67c69ef320ddd69881d4cc (11:58): http://www.w3.org/2009/cheatsheet/
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (12:01): no <datalist>
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (12:01): http://www.w3.org/2009/cheatsheet/#search,datalist
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (12:01): i mean, the app doesn't use <datalist>
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (12:02): well, datalist is quite unusable considering the webkit implementation
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:02): does use a non-polyglot DOCTYPE and a namespace declaration
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:02): hurray

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:05): Hmm, I think the GTK-in-HTML thing is rather neat. I mean, doing it with HTML widgets would be better but would probably have the disadvantage of not actually working
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:06): Obviously a11y is an issue
b844a0a98f81c321afe1d38ae37f3c28 (12:24): channel #whatwg
